title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.9 - Unauthorized parking and storage of aircraft prohibited
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1260.9 - Unauthorized parking and storage of aircraft prohibited

State Regulations

Unless otherwise provided in a lease or other
agreement, no person shall use any area of an air terminal (other than the
public aircraft parking and storage areas), for parking and storage of aircraft
without permission. When the manager deems that such use will not interfere
with the operation of an air terminal, and such permission is granted, the
charge for such use shall be double the rates provided in the schedule of
charges at such air terminal for the public aircraft parking and storage area
thereat, this charge to apply from the time the aircraft is so parked or stored
at the air terminal. If, notwithstanding the above prohibition, a person uses
such areas for parking or storage as aforesaid, without first obtaining such
permission, then the manager shall have authority to order the aircraft removed
or to cause the same to be removed and stored at the expense of the owner
thereof, without liability for damage thereto arising from or out of such
removal or storage. The above rate shall apply for the time said aircraft has
been so parked or stored at an air terminal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1260.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
